alert.note: Alert for Lincoln (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 26 at 1:52PM MDT until July 26 at 6:45PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Arroyo and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central New Mexico, including the following county, Lincoln. * WHEN...Until 500 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 151 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms moving towards the north. This will cause arroyo and small stream flooding. Between 0.5 and 0.75 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Ruidoso, Capitan, Fort Stanton, Smokey Bear Historical Park, Alto, Nogal and Angus. - This includes the following low water crossings... Devils Canyon Road at Eagle Creek, Devils Canyon Road, Salazar Canyon Road at Rio Bonito, Capitan Gap Road at Salado Creek, Dean Drive at North Fork Salado Creek, Sandia and Dean Drive at North Fork Salado Creek, Sandia Drive at North Fork Salado Creek, Sandesta Drive and Corrida de Rio at Rio Bonito, Sandesta Drive at Rio Bonito, Devils Canyon Road at Eagle Creek and Salazar Canyon Road at Rio Bonito. This includes the following highways... Highway 380 between Mile Markers 81 and 96. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
